subsection.name: Recursion Over Length Scales
subsection.p: The Force Field X multiscale infrastructure is designed around the principle of Recursion Over Length Scales (ROLS). Another well known example of ROLS is Renormalization.

subsection.name: Array of Atoms
subsection.p: The "Array of Atoms" data structure used by most modeling packages is not appropriate for multiscale modeling. It might even be asserted that this design choice (flaw), which is inherent in the structure of most modeling packages and algorithms, has limited progress toward the development of multiscale theories and codes.
Furthermore, in our experience, ROLS algorithms require two features not present (or difficult to implement and maintain) in programming languages most often used by scientists (FORTRAN and C).
A view of the Force Field X multiscale data structure for the crambin crystal unit cell.
